Name: L'Invite
Review Text:
Went here for dinner and it cost €330.
Unfortunately I found the food to be quite bland except for that which wasn’t cooked and served fresh, like oysters. There was one waiter and a young girl in …

Name: L'Invite
Review Text: Gorgeous location,  especially if the weather permits you to sit outside by the canal. Well thought-out tasting menu with lots of interesting tastes and largely local products. Excellent accompanying wines.

Name: L'Invite
Review Text: Lovely venue, great service. Smallish portions if you’re hungry, but take your time and savour them — wonderful flavors and taste. Worth going for sure. Only place I’ve eaten game meat that hasn’t actually tasted super-strong and gamey, just enough for taste but not overwhelming.

Name: L'Invite
Review Text: We were in Amsterdam for a few days before a cruise and asked the concierge at the Pulitzer hotel for a good restaurant featuring  local ingredients and cuisine. He suggested L'Invite as a great restaurant featuring Dutch cuisine with a …

Name: L'Invite
Review Text: Lunch menu was very good, the waiter was very polite and nice. Ceviche was delicious. the amuses, bread and little butters were a very nice surprise, highly recommend!

Name: L'Invite
Review Text: Overpriced dining with an overpromising (fine dining) website. Static menu, mise en place (cooking). 2/10 value for money. Oysters were good.

Name: L'Invite
Review Text: Lovely tasting menu dinner had here. We opted for the flight of Dutch wines to accompany the food. Yes, it’s expensive, but what fine dining with quite a lot of lovely wines isn’t? We had an extra glass of fizz to start, and a cheese course …

Name: L'Invite
Review Text:
It's not worth.

The place is cozy and the service is excellent. The Dutch wines are unbelievable …

Name: L'Invite
Review Text: In October we enjoyed a 3-week visit to Italy and Rhine cruise that concluded with 3 days in Amsterdam. Our accommodations on Bloemgracht were near l'Invite where we discovered the charm of an afternoon glass of wine on the waterside …

Name: L'Invite
Review Text:
Good but price quality ratio not so good.
We had a nice dinner portions were a bit small and food was special but did not taste special strangely enough. Wine was good but also not special. All in all …

Name: L'Invite
Review Text:
Good restaurant with a nice mix of traditional and modern. The food was tasty.
Service was not really to my taste, it's not unfriendly, but I didn't really care for the 'humor'.

Name: L'Invite
Review Text: This meal was fantastic and so worth the investment. Service was great, the decor was relaxed but still felt special, and the experience flew by, we wanted to stay the whole night. Can't wait to go back!

Name: L'Invite
Review Text: I really don't know how this got good reviews across all review sites because it's the worst fine dining experience I've ever had. …

Name: L'Invite
Review Text: 5 stars for location and service and the bread...however the experience was let down by 2 out of 5 of the dishes. The third dish was some strange cold root vegetable melange - basically 2 different kinds carrots, and various potatoes. The …

Name: L'Invite
Review Text: Elegant, expensive, WORTH EVERY EURO. Just a fantastic dining experience. Right up there will Eleven Madison Park. The owner is the waiter, server, cleaner, host, etc. But he does it with such ease and grace and beautiful service! Don't …

Name: L'Invite
Review Text: Wonderful breakfast after a transatlantic flight.  Staff couldn’t be nicer (even held our luggage!) and the sunlight, cappuccinos & eggs helped our jet lag.

Name: L'Invite
Review Text: I had a really delicious and elegant meal here with my boyfriend this week to celebrate our engagement. The food was fantastic and the service professional and knowledgable. I would love to go there again!

Name: L'Invite
Review Text:
Just had Christmas Eve dinner at l'Invité with my husband.
Great food. Great wines. Wonderful staff and fantastic service. We left very happy. …

Name: L'Invite
Review Text: This is a special, precious place. Hospitality means much to the friendly owner, the food is outstanding and the atmosphere fits a special occasion. If in town, try it out (it's worth the money!)

Name: L'Invite
Review Text: Great service. Food (Xmas lunch), was excellent, serving was well timed. I like their flexibility with food allergic customers. Pricing was appropriate.

Name: L'Invite
Review Text: French style with local motifs and ingridients cuisine. Raw mackerel with pickled cucumber sorbet and dutch creme with pear were marvelous.

Name: L'Invite
Review Text: Great service and good intimate experience !

Name: L'Invite
Review Text: Great food, great view!

Name: L'Invite
Review Text: Apparently kids aren't welcome. They expect kids can't eat an 7 course meal. And suggest you find some Italian food down the street. I suggest you take the kids to Envy or Janusz instead!

Name: L'Invite
Review Text: The ambience was great but my main course was served lukewarm. Service also a little slow. This restaurant is 70% to where it needs to be.

Name: L'Invite
Review Text: Sit at the canal side benches and enjoy a glass or two. Snack or eat a full meal all with attentive staff. A hidden gem.

Name: L'Invite
Review Text: Excellent tasting menu, local food and attentive service.

Name: L'Invite
Review Text: Absolutely brilliant experience at nye, great people and great food. Definitely coming back!

Name: L'Invite

Review Text: We ate here for New Year's Eve and really appreciated the excellent food.
